Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairperson of Hyundai Group and Her Party
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairperson of Hyundai Group and Her Party
    Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met Hyon Jong Un, chairperson of Hyundai Group of south Korea, and her party and president of Hyundai Asan Kim Yun Gyu and talked with them in a compatriotic atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, and officials concerned.

Choe Thae Bok Meets Member of Federal Assembly of Germany and His Party
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Member of Federal Assembly of Germany and His Party
    Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday met and had a friendly talk with Johannes Pflug, member of the Federal Assembly of Germany from the Social Democratic Party, and his party.
 Present there were officials concerned and the German ambassador e. p. to the DPRK.

articles.title: Diplomatic Relations Established between DPRK and San Marino
articles.content:
Diplomatic Relations Established between DPRK and San Marino
    Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- A joint communique on establishing diplomatic relations between the DPRK and San Marino was issued on Thursday.
 According to it, the DPRK and San Marino decided to open diplomatic relations at ambassador level on the basis of the 1961 Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations, prompted by the common desire to boost the friendly relations between the two countries.    
 The ambassadors of the two countries to Italy signed an agreement on the establishment of diplomatic relations on May 13, 2004.

articles.title: Congratulations to Malian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Malian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Ousmane Issoufi Maiga on his appointment as prime minister of Mali.
 In the message he expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future and wished the Malian prime minister great success in his responsible work for socio-economic development of the country.

articles.title: Chairperson of Hyundai Group of S. Korea and Her Party Leave
articles.content:
Chairperson of Hyundai Group of S. Korea and Her Party Leave
    Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Hyon Jong Un, chairperson of Hyundai Group of south Korea, and her party and Kim Yun Gyu, president of Hyundai Asan, left here on Thursday.
 They were seen off by Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, and officials concerned.    
 During their stay the chairperson and her party had working discussions on the issues of reenergizing tour of Mt. Kumgang and stepping up the construction of the Kaesong industrial zone with officials concerned of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, the National Economic Cooperation Federation and the General Bureau for Central Guidance to the Development of the Special Zone. They also visited the Mansudae Art Studio, the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, the Pyongyang Metro and other places.
